Subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Mitsunari Ishida


> At the time of Sekigahara he was the daimyo of Sawayama-Jo in present day
> northeast Shiga prefecture. One of his most loyal reatiners was Shima
Sakon
> who died at Sekigahara supposedly taking a bullet aimed at Mistunari.
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: squrpio_prince <squrpio_prince@...>
> To: <samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com>

> Subject: [samuraihistory] Mitsunari Ishida

messages.subject: Mitsunari Ishida
messages.msgSnippet: Whats up with him? Did he own a province prior to Sekigahara or did he still men away like he did most things? Who were his most loyal retainers?
messages.messageBody:
Whats up with him? Did he own a province prior to Sekigahara or did
he still men away like he did most things? Who were his most loyal
retainers?
